1.verse: Paul and Timothy, slaves of Christ Jesus, to all the saints in Christ Jesus being in Philippi, together-with the overseers and deacons:

2.verse: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

3.verse: I Thank God For Your Partnership With Me In The Gospel - I am giving-thanks to my God upon every remembrance of you,

4.verse: always in my every petition for you all making the petition with joy

5.verse: on-the-basis-of your partnership for the good-news from the first day until the present,

6.verse: being confident-of this very thing: that the One having begun a good work in you will perfect it until the day of Christ—

7.verse: just as it is right for me to think this about you all because of my having you in my heart, both in my imprisonment and in the defense and confirmation of the good-news, you all being my co-partners of grace.

8.verse: For God is my witness how I am yearning-for you all with the deep-feelings of Christ Jesus.

9.verse: May Your Love Abound Still More In Knowledge Leading To Holiness - And I am praying this: that your love may be abounding still more and more in knowledge and all perception

10.verse: so that you may be approving the things mattering, in-order-that you might be pure and blameless for the day of Christ,

11.verse: having been filled with the fruit of righteousness which comes through Jesus Christ to the glory and praise of God.

12.verse: Things Are Turning Out For The Good of The Gospel - Now I want you to know, brothers, that the things concerning me have come rather for the advancement of the good-news—

13.verse: The Brothers Are More Fearlessly Speaking The Word - ... so that my imprisonment in Christ became visible in the whole Praetorium and to all the rest,

14.verse: and so that the majority of the brothers, being confident in the Lord because-of my imprisonment, are more daring to fearlessly speak the word.

15.verse: Whatever Their Motives, Christ Is Being Proclaimed - Some indeed speak because of envy and strife, but some also are proclaiming Christ because of good-will.

16.verse: The ones speak out of love, knowing that I am appointed for the defense of the good-news;

17.verse: but the others are proclaiming Christ out of selfish-interest, not purely, supposing to raise trouble in my imprisonment.

18.verse: What indeed does it matter except that in every way, whether in pretense or in truth, Christ is being proclaimed! Christ Will Be Magnified In Me, Whether I Live or Die -And I am rejoicing in this. But I also will rejoice,

19.verse: for I know that this will turn-out for me for deliverance through your prayer and the provision of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,

20.verse: in-accordance-with my eager-expectation and hope that I will in no way be put-to-shame, but that with all boldness, as always, even now Christ will be magnified in my body, whether by life or by death—

21.verse: for to me, the living is Christ, and the dying is gain.

22.verse: Death Would Be Much Better For Me, But I Know I Will Continue To Live For Your Sake - Now if it is the living in the flesh, this for me means fruit from work. And I do not know what I shall choose,

23.verse: but am gripped by the two— having the desire that I might depart and be with Christ, for that is better by much more,

24.verse: but the remaining in the flesh is more-necessary for your sake.

25.verse: And being confident-of this, I know that I will remain and continue with you all for your advancement and joy of faith,

26.verse: in order that your boast may be abounding in Christ Jesus in me through my presence again with you.

27.verse: But Conduct Yourselves Worthily of The Gospel, And Don’t Be Frightened - Only be conducting-yourselves worthily of the good-news of Christ in order that whether having come and seen you or being absent, I may be hearing-of the things concerning you— that you are standing-firm in one spirit, contending-together with one soul for the faith of the good-news,

28.verse: and not being frightened in any way by the ones opposing you— which is a sign of destruction for them, but of your salvation, and this from God.

29.verse: God Has Granted That We Should Both Believe In Christ And Suffer For Him - Because to you was granted the thing for Christ’s sake— not only the believing in Him, but also the suffering for His sake,

30.verse: having the same struggle such as you saw in me and now are hearing to be in me.

1.verse: Fill Up My Joy By Being United In Love And Humility - If then there is any encouragement in Christ, if any consolation of  love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any deep-feelings and compassions,

2.verse: fill-up my joy, which is that you be thinking the same thing, having the same love, united-in-spirit, thinking the one thing,

3.verse: doing nothing based-on selfish-interest nor based on conceit, but with humble-mindedness regarding one another as surpassing yourselves;

4.verse: not each looking-out-for your own things, but also each the things of others.

5.verse: Think And Behave Like Christ Did - Be thinking this in you, which also was in Christ Jesus—

6.verse: Who, while being in the form of God, did not regard the being equal with God a thing-to-be-grasped,

7.verse: but emptied Himself, having taken the form of a slave, having come in the likeness of humans. And having been found as a man in outward-appearance,

8.verse: He humbled Himself, having become obedient to the point of death— and a death of a cross!

9.verse: Therefore God also highly-exalted Him, and granted Him the name above every name

10.verse: in-order-that every knee should bow at the name of Jesus— of heavenly ones and earthly ones and ones under-the-earth—

11.verse: and every tongue should confess-out that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.

12.verse: Work Out Your Salvation As Shining Lights In The World, Holding Out The Word of Life - So then my beloved, just as you always obeyed— not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence— be working-out your salvation with fear and trembling.

13.verse: For God is the One working in you both the wanting and the working, for His good-pleasure.

14.verse: Be doing all things without grumblings and arguments

15.verse: in-order-that you may become blameless and innocent, children of God without-blemish amidst a crooked and perverted generation, among whom you are shining as lights in the world,

16.verse: holding-out the word of life— for a boast for me in the day of Christ that I did not run in vain nor labor in vain!

17.verse: But Let Us Rejoice Together No Matter What Happens To Me - But if I even am being poured-out upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I am rejoicing [over it], and rejoicing-with you all.

18.verse: And you also be rejoicing the same way, and be rejoicing-with me.

19.verse: I Am Hoping To Send Timothy To You, And To Come Soon Myself - Now I am hoping in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you soon in order that I also may be cheered, having come-to-know the things concerning you.

20.verse: For I have no one likeminded who will genuinely be concerned-about the things concerning you.

21.verse: For the ones all are seeking their own things, not the things of Jesus Christ.

22.verse: But you know his approvedness, because he served with me for the good-news as a child with a father.

23.verse: So indeed I am hoping to send this one at-once, whenever I see the things with-respect-to me.

24.verse: And I am confident in the Lord that I myself also will come soon.

25.verse: I Sent Back Epaphroditus, Your Precious Servant To My Need. Rejoice In Him - But I regarded it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus— my brother and fellow-worker and fellow-soldier, and your delegate and minister of my need—

26.verse: because he was yearning-for you all, and was being distressed because you heard that he was sick.

27.verse: For indeed he was sick nearly to death. But God had-mercy-on him— and not him only, but also me, in order that I should not have grief upon grief.

28.verse: Therefore I sent him more-eagerly, in order that having seen him again you may rejoice, and I may be less-grieved.

29.verse: So receive him in the Lord with all joy, and be holding such ones precious,

30.verse: because he drew-near to the point of death for the sake of the work of Christ— having risked his life in order that he might fill-up your lack of service to me.

1.verse: Finally, Rejoice In The Lord - Finally, my brothers, be rejoicing in the Lord. To be writing the same things to you is not troublesome for me, and is safe for you—

2.verse: Watch Out For The False Circumcision - Be watching-out-for the dogs, be watching out for the evil workers, be watching out for the mutilation.

3.verse: For we are the circumcision, the ones worshiping in the Spirit of God and boasting in Christ Jesus and not putting-confidence in the flesh—

4.verse: though myself having confidence even in the flesh! If Anyone Can Put Confidence In The Flesh, I More -If any other person thinks that he may put-confidence in the flesh, I more—

5.verse: in circumcision the eighth day; from the nation of Israel, the tribe of Benjamin, a Hebrew from Hebrews; in relation to the Law— a Pharisee;

6.verse: in relation to zeal— persecuting the church; in relation to the righteousness in the Law— having been blameless.

7.verse: But I Count All Such Things As Loss That I May Know Christ And His Power - But what things were gains to me, these I have regarded to be a loss for the sake of Christ.

8.verse: But more than that, I am indeed regarding all things to be a loss for the sake of the surpassing greatness of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord, for the sake of Whom I suffered-loss-of all things and am regarding them as garbage in order that I might gain Christ

9.verse: and be found in Him, not having my own righteousness from the Law but the one through faith in Christ, the righteousness from God on the basis of faith—

10.verse: that I might know Him and the power of His resurrection and the partnership of His sufferings, being conformed to His death

11.verse: if somehow I might attain to [the power of] the resurrection-out from the dead.

12.verse: Brothers, I Am Forgetting The Past And Pressing On Toward The True Prize - Not that I already obtained it or have already been made-perfect, but I am pressing-on to see if I may indeed take-hold-of  that for which also I was taken hold of by Christ Jesus.

13.verse: Brothers, I do not consider myself to have taken hold, but one thing I do: forgetting the things behind and stretching-toward the things ahead,

14.verse: I am pressing-on toward the goal for the prize of the upward calling from God in Christ Jesus.

15.verse: All Who Claim To Be Mature: Think This Same Way. Imitate Me - Therefore, all who are mature— let us be thinking this. And if you are thinking anything differently, God will reveal this also to you.

16.verse: Nevertheless, to what thinking we attained, by the same let us be walking-in-line.

17.verse: Be fellow-imitators of me, brothers, and be watching the ones walking in this manner, just as you have us as a pattern.

18.verse: For There Are Many Enemies of The Cross. They Focus On Earthly Things - For many walk as to whom I was often saying to you, and now even weeping say, they are the enemies of the cross of Christ—

19.verse: whose end is destruction, whose god is their stomach and glory is in their shame— the ones thinking the earthly things.

20.verse: And Our Citizenship Is In Heaven - For our place-of-citizenship is in the heavens, from where also we are eagerly-awaiting the Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ,

21.verse: Who will transform the body of our lowliness so as to be similar-in-form to the body of His glory, according-to the working that enables Him also to subject all things to Himself.

1.verse: So My Beloved, Stand Firm In This Manner - So then, my beloved and yearned-for brothers, my joy and crown, be standing-firm in this manner in the Lord, beloved.

2.verse: Help My Fellow-Workers To Think The Same Thing - I exhort Euodia and I exhort Syntyche to be thinking the same thing in the Lord.

3.verse: Yes, I ask you also, genuine comrade, be helping these women who contended-together with me in connection with the good-news, along-with both Clement and the rest of my fellow-workers, whose names are in the book of life.

4.verse: Be Rejoicing In The Lord, Kind To All, And Praying To God - Be rejoicing in the Lord always; again I will say, be rejoicing.

5.verse: Let your kindness be known to all people. The Lord is near.

6.verse: Be anxious-about nothing, but in everything, by prayer and petition with thanksgivings, let your requests be made-known to God.

7.verse: And the peace of God surpassing all understanding will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.

8.verse: Be Considering And Practicing All That Is True And Commendable - Finally, brothers, be considering these things— whatever things are true, whatever things are honorable, whatever things are right, whatever things are pure, whatever things are lovely, whatever things are commendable, if there is any virtue, and if there is any praise.

9.verse: Be practicing these things which you indeed learned and received and heard and saw in me, and the God of peace will be with you.

10.verse: Thank You For The Gift Epaphroditus Brought, And Your Continuing Partnership With Me - Now I rejoiced in the Lord greatly that now at last you revived your thinking about me— upon which indeed you were thinking, but you were lacking-opportunity.

11.verse: Not that I speak in relation to a need, for I learned to be content in the things in which I am.

12.verse: I indeed know-how to be humbled. I also know-how to abound. In anything and in all things, I have learned-the-secret— both to be filled-to-satisfaction and to be hungry, both to abound and to be in-need.

13.verse: I can-do all things by-means-of  the One strengthening me.

14.verse: Nevertheless, you did well having co-partnered in my affliction.

15.verse: You Alone Have Partnered With Me From The First - And you also know, Philippians, that in the beginning of the good-news when I departed from Macedonia, no church partnered with me in the matter of giving and receiving except you alone.

16.verse: Because even in Thessalonica you sent to me both once and twice for my need.

17.verse: Not that I am seeking-for the gift, but I am seeking-for the fruit increasing to your account.

18.verse: I Have Received Your Pleasing Offering To God, And I Am Abounding - And I am receiving everything in full, and I am abounding. I have been filled-up, having received from Epaphroditus the things from you— an aroma of fragrance, an acceptable sacrifice, pleasing to God.

19.verse: And my God will fill-up every need of yours in-accordance-with His riches in glory in Christ Jesus.

20.verse: Now to our God and Father be the glory forever and ever, amen.

21.verse: Greet every saint in Christ Jesus. The brothers with me greet you.

22.verse: All the saints greet you, but especially the ones from Caesar’s household.

23.verse: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
